body_html:
I think it's that clang is too old and doesn't support the __attribute__ for the cxx abi.

So, maybe, either:

  1. Use gcc-4.8 to build tensorflow (apt-get install gcc-4.8), then set env variables CC and CXX
  2. Upgrade llvm using this procedure so that it honors the flags. You can build a hello world and check nm output
  3. Rebuild your code using the system compiler, gcc5
body_text:
I think it's that clang is too old and doesn't support the __attribute__ for the cxx abi.
So, maybe, either:

Use gcc-4.8 to build tensorflow (apt-get install gcc-4.8), then set env variables CC and CXX
Upgrade llvm using this procedure so that it honors the flags. You can build a hello world and check nm output
Rebuild your code using the system compiler, gcc5
body:
I think it's that clang is too old and doesn't support the `__attribute__` for the cxx abi.

So, maybe, _either_:
1. Use gcc-4.8 to build tensorflow (apt-get install gcc-4.8), then set env variables `CC` and `CXX`
2. Upgrade llvm using [this procedure](http://askubuntu.com/questions/787383/how-to-install-llvm-3-9) so that it honors the flags. You can build a hello world and check `nm` output
3. Rebuild your code using the system compiler, gcc5
